section.p: The Indication Observation documents the rationale for an activity. It can do this with the id element to reference a problem recorded elsewhere in the document or with a code and value to record the problem type and problem within the Indication. For example, the indication for a prescription of a painkiller might be a headache that is documented in the Problems Section

ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass) (CONF:7480)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood) (CONF:7481)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] id (CONF:7483)
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] code, which SHOULD be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.2 Problem Type STATIC 2008-12-18 (CONF:7484)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode/@code="completed" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 ActStatus) (CONF:7487)
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] effectiveTime (CONF:7488)
SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] value, which SHOULD be selected from ValueSet 2.16.840.1.113883.3.88.12.3221.7.4 Problem DYNAMIC, where its data type is CD (CONF:7489, CONF:7991)
MAY satisfy: Set the observation/id equal to an ID on the problem list to signify that problem as an indication (CONF:9321)
The value element MAY contain @nullFlavor (CONF:10088)

If the diagnosis is unkown or the SNOMED code is unknown, @nullFlavor SHOULD be "UNK". If the code is something other than SNOMED, @nullFlavor SHOULD be "OTH" and the other code SHOULD be placed in the translation element. (CONF:10089)
